org.apache.tephra

Class AbstractTransactionAwareTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tephra.AbstractTransactionAwareTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionAwareHTable

    public abstract class AbstractTransactionAwareTable
extends Object
implements TransactionAware
    Base class for all the common parts of the HBase version-specific TransactionAwareHTable implementations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  AbstractTransactionAwareTable.ActionChange
      Record of each transaction that causes a change.

      • startTx

        public void startTx(Transaction tx)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Called when new transaction has started. This may reset any state which has been left behind by the previous transaction.
        Specified by:
        startTx in interface TransactionAware
        Parameters:
        tx - transaction info

      • updateTx

        public void updateTx(Transaction tx)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Called when the state of the current transaction has been updated. This should replace any reference to the current Transaction held by this TransactionAware, but should not reset any state (such as the write change sets) that is currently maintained.
        Specified by:
        updateTx in interface TransactionAware
        Parameters:
        tx - the updated transaction

      • getTxChanges

        public Collection<byte[]> getTxChanges()
        Specified by:
        getTxChanges in interface TransactionAware
        Returns:
        changes made by current transaction to be used for conflicts detection before commit.

      • getVIntBytes

        protected byte[] getVIntBytes(long vint)
        Parameters:
        vint - long to make a vint of.
        Returns:
        long in vint byte array representation We could alternatively make this abstract and implement this method as Bytes.vintToBytes(long) in every compat module.

      • getChangeKey

        public byte[] getChangeKey(byte[] row,
                           byte[] family,
                           byte[] qualifier)
        The unique bytes identifying what is changing. We use the following structure: ROW conflict level: <0 byte separator> since we know that table_name cannot contain a zero byte. COLUMN conflict level: <0 byte separator> The last part of the change key does not need the length to be part of the key since there's nothing after it that may overlap with it.
        Parameters:
        row -
        family -
        qualifier -
        Returns:
        unique change key

      • commitTx

        public boolean commitTx()
                 throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Called before transaction has been committed. Can be used e.g. to flush changes cached in-memory to persistent store.
        Specified by:
        commitTx in interface TransactionAware
        Returns:
        true if transaction can be committed, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doCommit

        protected abstract boolean doCommit()
                             throws IOException
        Commits any pending writes by flushing the wrapped HTable instance.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • postTxCommit

        public void postTxCommit()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Called after transaction has been committed. Can be used e.g. evict entries from a cache etc. Because this is called after the transaction is committed, the success or failure of the transaction cannot depend on it. Hence this method returns nothing and it is not expected to throw exceptions.
        Specified by:
        postTxCommit in interface TransactionAware

      • getTransactionAwareName

        public String getTransactionAwareName()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Used for error reporting.
        Specified by:
        getTransactionAwareName in interface TransactionAware

      • getTableKey

        protected abstract byte[] getTableKey()
        Returns the table name to use as a key prefix for the transaction change set.

      • rollbackTx

        public boolean rollbackTx()
                   throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: TransactionAware
        Called during transaction rollback (for whatever reason: conflicts, errors, etc.).
        Specified by:
        rollbackTx in interface TransactionAware
        Returns:
        true if all changes made during transaction were rolled back, false otherwise (e.g. if more cleanup needed or changes cannot be undone). True also means that this transaction can be made visible to others without breaking consistency of the data: since all changes were undone there's "nothing to see".
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doRollback

        protected abstract boolean doRollback()
                               throws Exception
        Rolls back any persisted changes from the transaction by issuing offsetting deletes to the wrapped HTable instance. How this is handled will depend on the delete API exposed by the specific version of HBase.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • addToChangeSet

        protected void addToChangeSet(byte[] row,
                              byte[] family,
                              byte[] qualifier)
